intro: Cordia marioniae, commonly known as Marion's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. Cordia marioniae is adapted to the tropical climate of Mauritius and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests.
